author: Citizen Cardano
title: "They desire a better country."
description: Proposers feel left out once their ideas have been rejected, while others further in the Catalyst funnel receive rewards for participating.

author: Chris Patten-Walker
title: Cardano Mobile App
description: Members need a structured format to easily on board to the Project Catalyst project in a format they are familar with.

author: Ryan Morrison
title: Cardano Podcast  Interviews w/Teams
description: We don't know who are the people behind each project on Catalyst. We can only read their and the name of the author.

author: jeffg
title: Create Social Network in Catalyst
description: Create a social network so participants can like and work with each other and shares ideas and collaborate.

author: Jean
title: Encourage proposals
description: Proposers play an all or nothing role and they can't vote.

author: Michael McNulty
title: Guided Onboarding Experience
description: Newbies need more than documentation. When onboarding is self-guided, we create undue friction for incoming talent. Let's make it personal.

author: Hiro Goto
title: Incentivizing interaction
description: Breakthrough innovations are NOT brought about by individuals of similar background. :fearful:

author: Philip Khoo
title: Project Catalyst Landing Page
description: There is no central place for new and existing community members of Project Catalyst to find the info and links they need.

author: Q U A S A R
title: Social Physics-Balloon Challenge
description: Catalyst lacks the ability to create "value" to engage community members. We are also challenged with defining "value".

author: Karam H
title: Teaming to integrate multiple ideas
description: Individuals only give one perspective on ideas for the future of Cardano and may lose interest overtime.

author: WADA(West Africa Decentralized Alliance)
title: West Africa Catalyst Onboarding
description: No streamlined framework to onboard talented West Africans making contact through Cardano websites/social media/groups into Project Catalyst
